page.title: 15Aberystwyth news.July 5th 85
page.content: Some news reports in the Cambrian News (Aberystwyth's weekly newspaper for wk. ending July 5th 1985) {The wettest June for 50 yrs.}There was 165mm of rain,the average being 70mm for June in the Aberystwyth area. {Better road links needed.}Councillors call for better road links to M4.Aberystwyth too isolated.Local roads in poor condition and more money is needed.{Bombs found on beach.}20 mortar bombs found on beach near Aber.Safely detonated by Bomb disposal unit.{Oil at Ynys Las kills wildlife.} Oil washed ashore killed a seal and fifteen sea birds.{Graffiti teenagers {fined.}Two boys who sprayed the walls of public builings were fined Â£176.{ {Campaign to safeguard Welsh Woodlands. Welsh Minister of State launched COED CYMRU,a major project to arrest the decline of trees in Wales.
